Eines meiner absoluten Lieblingsspiele. Es ist zwar alt, dennoch braucht es sich vor neuen Shootern nicht zu verstecken. Die Grafik kann sich immer noch sehen lassen und die Engine ist auch nicht sperrig. Das Waffenfeeling ist super und der Rückstoß ist so, wie man in bei solchen Waffen erwarten würde.
Alles in allem also ein super Spiel, welches auch auf älteren Rechnern läuft(und Surftabs auch, unglaublich, nicht wahr:) ) und für Shooterfans, die mal eine realistischere Alternative zu Battlefield oder COD haben wollen eine absolute Empfehlung.

Honestly if you asked me today I couldnt tell you if DoD or DoD:S is better. Both have great features, linux support, and of course awesome gameplay.

Since both of the DoD titles rock, I'll make a pros list rather than a pros/cons list for the original DoD:

-Many classes for lots of variety in playstyles.
-A pretty nice hud.
-Awesome servers.
-Good graphics for GoldSrc.
-Nice sound quality.
-Great price(I'd still get it in CS1 Anthology though).
-Balanced weapons.
-WW2 themed.

Yeah, I love this game.

Klasik Valve Oyunlarından biri. Takım odaklı 2.Dünya Savaşı oyunu. Takım arkadaşlarınızla vaktine göre heyecan uyandıran çatışmalara girmeye hazırlanın. Eğer takım odaklı oyunları seviyorsanız bunuda seveceksinizdir. Benden bir öneri sakın tek başınıza ramboculuk oynamayın yoksa sonu kötü bitiyor.

This is the standalone version of a mod for Half-Life 1 that plays pretty much the same now as it did when it came out 16-17 years ago.  I played this almost every night when I was in high school and wouldn't be surprised if I put 1000+ hours into the original mod.  

Coming back to this game after over a decade away I find it's still one of my favourites.  The gameplay is pretty basic by modern FPS standards, coming from an era where things like free mouselook were still kind of new.  Even the ancient BF1942 is more advanced than Day of Defeat.  And this isn't a Battlefield game - no vehicles, no huge maps and far less time from spawn to action.  

What this game offers is intense rifle and SMG combat as two sides battle over flags.  Snipers and machine-gunners will find themselves at home as much as players like myself who prefer to charge forward with no cares in the world.  The gameplay is pretty similar to Counterstrike, although there are understandably fewer automatic weapons and more reliance on bolt-action rifles and grenades.

There is a small but loyal server population.  I recommend playing on the Merrill's Marauders servers - they have a 24/7 Caen server (Caen is one of the best original maps) as well as a 24/7 Avalanche server (perhaps the most popular map of all time).  Their players tend to be older guys like myself and, though polite and fun to play and chat with, aren't exactly slouches when it comes to playing DoD.  Mature, but challenging competition awaits.  The Merrill's servers use bots for times when server populations are low, so there will always be at least a little action.

I heartily recommend getting back into the game for anyone who played the mod almost two decades ago.  I also strongly recommend the game for older gamers (30s+)  who prefer playing with others around their age group.  You'll find that the simplicity of the game mechanics means any hand-eye coordination you've lost over the years won't mean quite as much as it might playing CoD or Battlefield.

I give the game a "sure, why not?" for younger gamers who are just getting into first-person shooters.  Learn the ropes with some old pros before moving on to fancier and more expensive games (on sale, DoD costs as much as a snack).

Young gamers who are FPS pros should probably give this game a pass, because the aging graphics and archaic mechanics might prove frustrating and limiting.  Then again, you just might enjoy yourselves, and for a few bucks it isn't a big investment.

Summary:  One of the best "original" mutiplayer FPS experiences, in my opinion.  I didn't happen to own the Quake or Tribes games back in the 90s, but I was definitely a hoarder of Half-Life mods.  Old gamers may appreciate it more than younger ones thanks to the nostalgia and aged community, but young gamers might have fun too.  It will *not* blow you away with its graphics, and its mechanics are certainly far from innovative in 2016, but given that the game might very well be older than the person reading this, that can't be helped.

Give it a go!

(Note on DoD Source - I haven't really played Source much, but from what I understand it changes a lot of mechanics to work with the newer Source engine and is missing some classic maps like Caen.  You might get more mileage out of Source, but then again you might not - up to your discretion).

This game has no bells and whistles. It is all straight forward first-person shooter online action. Just player model and weapon - single shot rifles, semi-auto machine guns, sniper, machine gun, bazooka, and knife (or bayonet and trench shovel). 

What makes this game excellent? The player control of the models and guns is tight - extremely tight. It feels seamless between ones choice of movement and the actual gameplay. In this sense one feels in complete control, and thus the behaviour of your players feels like a true extention of oneself. 

The game lends itself well to teamplay with excellent voice over microphone. The sound in the game is very good, and listening is a critical part of playing well. 

The Day of Defeat community is extensive and skilled and has produced an enormous amount of modified material. There are tons and tons of player created custom maps which are equal in quality to the core of 20 stock maps which come with the game. 

Half-Life is the greatest shooter game ever. So is it any doubt that this ww2-based modification of Half-Life is the greatest WW2 shooter? It has been around for 13 years now, so the skill level of the player base is fairly high. However, DOD players are usually well-helpful to new players. 

If you like running and gunning in a WW2 environment, you gotta give this game a try. You can also play it off-line by installing free bots (Sturmbots) to learn with.

It was a mod that got picked up and sold by Valve, it holds all the jankiness of community mods and offers little. The real gameplay diffrence between this and TFC arn't that big. Both games are games you pretty much die in a hurry and have really annoying metagame.  Nostalgia aside, as I have none anyway, I think it sucks. I occasionally try it now and then but in the face of COD 1 to 3 this game was just not good or worth playing. It adds nothing to the table and has nothing interesting to say about it. Its just another shooter you shouldn't waste money on.

Old multiplayer Half-Life mod given a standalone release in 2003 that presents a range of WWII tactical infantry combat scenarios (more than [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/trar/recommended/300]its sequel[/url] at least.) Still fun to play, despite showing its age and being janky from attempting tactical combat with the original HL engine. It's more for retro fans really. You could sum it up as a class-based [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/trar/recommended/10]Counter-Strike[/url] equivalent with respawning that encourages teamwork slightly more.

As befitting a CS-like game, there's still a decent number of players, although definitely less than CS. Many of them are veterans, so bring your shooting hand.

"Point is captured!" an Allied soldier calls as our squad moves down the alleyway, leading into the larger war-torn plaza. A man to my right gets gunned down by Soviet sniper fire, and I immediately drop to the ground. A faint clink registers to the left of my person. A grenade. I respawn, run around tthe corner carrying a springfield rifle, and am quickly cut down again by a filthy camper to the right of our spawning alley. I angrily mumble "Camper on right side of alley," and almost immediately 3 of my teamates converge on the soldier intrenched in a demolished shop. 2 grenades follow up my callout, and a soldier wielding a Garand comes to to crush his skull with a rifle butt. 

Once again, we sprint to cover in the alley leading to the plaza. But this time, there's a soldier up on the second story of a building to our left chucking potato mashers in our small group of 4-5 people. This time, I admit I'm only wielding a springfield and that sombebody else will need to take the lead into the building. Shockingly, an Allied soldier carrying a Thompson hears my call and moves in ahead of me to take out the camper from behind. I pull out my little 1911 handgun and follow after, in case he needs the backup. A single potato masher tumbles to the Thompson gunner and he crumples to the floor. I sprint past him to the top of the building and gun down the Soviet, and call it out to my team so we can move up. I get back downstairs to move across the street, only to crumple to the ground as a sniper picks me off.

1911/1944 IGN

In general, the community for this game is very active, especially considering how old it is, and I thoroughly enjoyed making callouts and following up on coordinated charges into the plaza, for hours on end. It's good, and cheap, and most importantly, you get to kill communists endlessly.

Gran juego proveniente del mítico Counter Strike 1.6 pero muy diferente en todo,las armas y clases son 10/10 está bien equilibrado aunque no haya sistema de subir nivel skins etc...  es muy entretenido y engancha. Si te gusta el juego en equipo y los juegos de guerra, este juego es el mejor, pues no solo es imprescindible que mates ni quedes positivo relacion bajas-muertes incluso, lo importante es jugar en equipo para obtener todas las banderas las maximas veces posibes dentro del tiempo de partida para ganar. 
Dos bandos: Aliados (Allies) y Eje (Axis) con distintas armas en las clases.

El sistema antihack está muy bien apenas hay hackers. 
Controles similares al counter 1.6 ya que este juego proviene de ahí, aunque las armas tienen diferente desvio y clases no personalizables, aunque equilibradas y variadas.

En fin,por este precio es una joya para los que lo jugamos en su dia,no os lo penseis de volver a comprarlo!! Y los que no lo jugasteis en su dia,si os gusta el juego en equipo y la guerra en 1º persona bélica clasica,este es vuestro juego. VIVA DoD!! 10/10 (El source tiene mejores graficos, pero nada mas, sigue siendo mejor este, el clasico).

Un call of duty de goldsrc, un juego tipo Team fortress pero centrado en la segunda guerra mundial, es mejor que te lo vengas comprando porque no tiene servidores no steam, y si los ahi los unicos que te aceptaran seran los chinos, que en un corto lapzo de tiempo te sacaran del servidor.

Надоел COUNTER STRIKE? Тогда покупайте эту игру, тут много тактических возможностей (как в контре) и очень большие и интересные карты. Режимов кроме захвата флага больше не нашел. Из оружия там винтовка, скорострельная винтовка, 2 пулемета , 2 автомата , снайперка и базука (у гитлеров))) на 1 или на 2  оружия больше). Это все там как в TF классы (снайпер , сержант(да это класс), пехотинец и тд) и все оружие естественно  бесплатно (у каждого класса свое оружие) , но у англичан всего лишь 5 или 4 класса (они попадаются очень редко)

The is my favorite WWII game and the first game I played on Steam. (and yes, people still are playing)

Pros: 
1: Mature and helpful community.
2: Very fun WWII action with different maps and game modes.
3: Not repetitive and doesn't get boring, ex; Different Guns, Custom maps, Gamemodes, etc.
4. High skill ceiling, always room to improve.

Cons:
1: Most players are very experienced and you will die alot.
2: Game mechanics take time to learn.

9/10, Most underrated Valve series. 
Buy it now or get it on a sale, either way you won't regret it!

Gran juego ambientado en la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Al igual que Counter-Strike, nació como un mod de HL, por lo que el modo de juego es similar a este, salvo que en lugar de enfrentarse terroristas contra antiterroristas se enfrentan Aliados contra el Eje excepto en algún mapa en el que encontraremos al Ejército Británico en lugar de los Aliados.
Los modos de juego consisten en "Capturar la bandera", "Capturar el objetivo" y "Destruir el objetivo". Las armas son réplicas de las usadas en la 2ªGM al igual que los mapas, los cuales recrean grandes batallas como la de Normandía.
